sen.j: 和気氏（わけうじ）は、備前国和気郡（古くは藤野郡と称した）を本拠とした豪族である。
sen.e: The Wake clan was a Gozoku (local ruling family) based in Wake District, Bizen Province (its old name was Fujjno District).

sen.e: The surname was changed from Kimi to Mahito, and to Sukune, and in 774 the surname Ason was given.

sen.j: 奈良時代和気広虫（出家して法均尼と号する）と弟の和気清麻呂が僧道鏡に対する宇佐八幡宮神託事件で功があって朝廷に進出し、藤野別真人から和気朝臣の氏姓が与えられた。
sen.e: In the Nara period, WAKE no Hiromushi (he adopted the name Hokin-ni after entering into priesthood) and his younger brother WAKE no Kiyomaro, who had made achievements in a plot of Usa Hachiman-gu oracle against Buddhist monk Dokyo, advanced to the Imperial court and Fujinowake no Mahito gave them the surname Wake Ason.

sen.j: 清麻呂の子和気広世などは学者として朝廷に仕え、広世は和気氏出身者のための大学別曹の弘文院を設置している。
sen.e: Kiyomaro's son, WAKE no Hiroyo served the Imperial court as a scholar, and Hiroyo established Kobun-in, which was Daigaku-besso (academic facility for nobles) for the members of the clan.
